Odprem vama v zapeljivi, elegantni, ženstveni obleki in vaju popeljem v višje nadstropje, kjer se pri nas izpolnjujejo fantazije. Ogreti smo, sedaj pa naj se simfonija začne…« V mislih že prehitevam in prijemam njeno mehko, nežno oprsje a z rokami najprej obdelujem njen napet hrbet. Z ženstvenim dotikom, čutno in elegantno prispem do njene lepo zaobljene zadnjice. Vidim, da uživa, saj je noge tiho in neopazno razširila. Masaža Simfonija je izjemna izkušnja, ki bi jo moral poznati vsak par. Velika mera igrivosti, veselja, strasti in zanosa… Vidva v družbi naše izbrane maserke, polne čutnosti, se skupaj podata v nekaj nepozabnega, s telesom ob telesu, kjer se boste s čutnim dotikanjem in senzualno povezanostjo dvignili na višji nivo erotike. Kombinacij je veliko, naša dekleta pa se rade prilagodijo vašim željam.

en_doc: A home stereo or home cinema is an investment for you and your family to enjoy for years to come. Just as you did not buy your car in the local supermarket, there is no reason why you should buy speakers just anywhere. In AS we sell everything that is connected to good sound - no refrigerators, ovens, or bathtubs. How your average day will change with our HiFi: You will watch more movies. You will listen to more music. You will enjoy your favorite songs better, because you will suddenly notice their new dimensions, dimensions you did not hear before, because your old HiFi did not let you. Do you know how it feels to hear the landing of a helicopter on really good speakers? Probably not yet... maybe soon. You will throw more parties. People will visit you, because the will long to hear this new HiFi of your one more time.
sl_doc: Domači stereo ali domači kino je investicija zate in za vso družino, da uživate v njem leta in leta. Tako kot avta ne kupiš v najbližjem supermarketu, tudi ni razloga, da bi igral rusko ruleto pri nakupu zvoka. V Audio Serumu prodajamo vse, kar je povezano z dobrim zvokom - nobenih hladilnikov, pralnih strojev ali ročnih mešalnikov. Kako se bo spremenil tvoj povprečen dan z našim hifijem: Več filmov boš gledal. Več glasbe boš poslušal. Bolj boš užival v znanih komadih, ker bodo kar naenkrat dobili več razsežnosti, stvari, ki jih prej nisi slišal, ker ti tvoj HiFi ni pustil. A veš, kako je, ko na hudih zvočnikih poslušaš pristajanje helikopterja? Verjetno še ne... morda kmalu. Več zabav boš prirejal. Ljudje bodo prihajali k tebi, ker bodo hrepeneli, da spet slišijo tvoj nov HiFi.

en_doc: Document Examination Section NAC/CNAC The Document Examination Section NAC/CNAC was long known as the Graphology Examination Section, although its experts argued for years that their domain was not preparing graphology expert opinions but performing forensic investigations of manuscripts and signatures. From 1996 to 2000 it operated as the Document Examination Desk due to its small size; in 2000, it was renamed the Manuscript and Document Examination Section, and since 2006 it has been known as the Document Examination Section NAC/CNAC (National Analytical Centre/CoinNational Analytical Centre). In addition to identifying authors of manuscripts and signatures and identifying dactyloscripts, it also kept a record of dactyloscripts, which is no longer in use, and a collection of anonymous letters, which is still being used. Examinations of manuscripts to establish the identity of two or more manuscripts, which may be used to identify the manuscript's author. Examinations of signatures to establish the identity of two or more signatures, which are used to identify the signatory. Examinations of identity documents and documents in legal transactions (contracts, wills, insurance policies, etc.) - establishing whether the document is authentic, forged or changed, establishing the method used to forge documents, and ascertaining which parts of the document were changed and how. Examinations of latent impressions, enhancing the visibility of latent impressions on various paper documents. Examinations of banknotes (euro and other currencies), establishing their authenticity, note-making techniques, and identifying the source of the forgery.
sl_doc: Oddelek za preiskave dokumentov NAC/CNAC Oddelek za preiskave dokumentov NAC/CNAC* se je dolgo imenoval Sektor za grafološke preiskave, čeprav so njegovi strokovnjaki vrsto let opozarjali, da njihova dejavnost niso grafološke ekspertize, ampak forenzično preiskovanje rokopisov in podpisov. Zaradi svoje majhnosti je bil od leta 1996 do 2000 preimenovan v Referat za preiskavo dokumentov, od leta 2000 do 2006 se je imenoval Oddelek za preiskave rokopisov in dokumentov, od leta 2006 pa Oddelek za preiskave dokumentov NAC/CNAC. Poleg identificiranja piscev rokopisov in podpisov ter identifikacije strojnih pisav je pripravljal tudi zbirko tipkopisov, ki danes ni več v uporabi, in zbirko anonimnih pisem, ki je še vedno uporabna. preiskave rokopisov z namenom ugotavljanja istovetnosti oziroma neistovetnosti dveh ali več rokopisnih zapisov, s čimer je mogoče ugotoviti avtorja zapisa; preiskave podpisov z namenom ugotavljanja istovetnosti oziroma neistovetnosti dveh ali več podpisov, s čimer je mogoče ugotoviti avtorja podpisa; preiskave identifikacijskih dokumentov in dokumentov v pravnem prometu (pogodbe, oporoke, zavarovalne police ipd.) - ugotavljanje, ali je dokument pristen, ponarejen ali spremenjen, ugotavljanje načina izdelave ponarejenih dokumentov in ugotavljanje, kateri deli dokumentov so spremenjeni in kako; preiskave latentnih zapisov in izboljšanje vidnosti latentnih zapisov na najrazličnejših papirnih listinah; preiskave bankovcev (evra in drugih valut), ugotavljanje njihove pristnosti in načina izdelave ter ugotavljanje vira ponaredka;

en_doc: Pinta Window Butyl tape Pinta Window Butyl tape is a self-adhesive rubber based sealing tape with high adhesive strength, laminated on one side with the plasticized film. It is provided with a special self-adhesive tape for attachment to the door frame and with the fleece fabric to enable the further processing. The standard product manufactured by Pinta Abdichtug GmbH has the appropriate verification system or a certificate that guarantees investors a safe and reliable product use.
sl_doc: Izdelek je dobavljiv po naročilu. Izdelek je dobavljiv po naročilu. Prednosti izdelka: Pinta okenski butil Pinta okenski butil je samolepilni tesnilni trak na osnovi kavčuka z veliko lepilno močjo, ki je na eni strani laminiran s plastificirano folijo. Opremljen je tudi z namenskim samolepilnim trakom za pritrditev na podboj in flisom, ki omogoča nadaljnjo obdelavo.

en_doc: Since 2008 we have certified production for high-strenght preloaded bolt joints by SIST EN 14399-1:2015 (HV bolts made by EN 14399-4 and fit bolt made by EN 14399-8) and high strength bolt joints without preload by SIST EN 15048-1:2007. By prior arrangement we could provide 2.2 or 3.1 Certificates for all products. We also take care of any other coating of your choice (dacromet, paiting with cataphoresis procedure, phosphatization etc.). In year 2019 our manufactoring program was upgraded with more detailed and complicated products made by CNC machines. They can be produced from various quality of steel, alumminium, copper, brass, bronze, plastic, textolite… By improving production it leaded to upgrade basic programs with with which we support production with tehnical documentation and which is used for CAM preparation of CNC operating programs. After every operation in manufacturing bolts it is tested with controlled measuring tools including FARO 3D MEASURING ARM. In case of high demands of customer the product are additional tested performed by IMK Ljubljana (we have been cooperating with them for more than 30 years) and they regulary controle and supervise our production. On CNC turning machine we can offer machining:: BLAS-TIP company can produce not only standard goods but also various bolts according drawings, sketches or samples, we also produce different machine parts according samples and/or drawings.
sl_doc: Od leta 2008 imamo certificirano proizvodnjo za izdelavo vijakov za visokotrdnostne prednapete vijačne zveze po SIST EN 14399-1:2015 (HV vijaki izdelani po EN 14399-4 in prilagodni HV vijaki po EN 14399-8) in visokotrdnostne vijačne zveze brez prednapetja po SIST EN 15048-1:2007. Po predhodnem dogovoru vam lahko izdamo tudi 2.2 ali 3.1 certifikate tudi za ostale izdelke. Na vašo željo poskrbimo tudi za kakšno drugo zaščito (dacrome, barvanje s postopkom kataforeze, fosfatizacija, ...). Naš proizvodni program smo v let 2019 nadgradili z izdelavo zahtevnih izdelkov s CNC obdelavo. Izdelamo lahko proizvode iz vseh kvalitet jekla, aluminija, medenine, bakra, brona, plastike, tekstolita, vulkolana, ... Tehnično dokumentacijo za proizvodne procese pripravljamo z programom, ki nam omogoča računalniško podporo konstruiranja, zajema 3D modelirnik in modul za izdelavo tehniške dokumentacije. Proizvodni procesi so podprti tudi z za CAM pripravo CNC programov. Kontrola procesov se vrši po zaključku vsake operacije izdelave z umerjeno merilno tehniko vključno s FARO 3D merilno roko. V primeru potreb po dokumentiranem preizkušanju izdelkov s strani zunanje inštitucije (predvsem vijakov) nam že več kot 30 let vrši kontrolo Inštitut za metalne konstrukcije (IMK) Ljubljana, ki je tudi naš nadzorni organ za proizvodnjo vijačnih zvez po EN 14399-1 in EN 15048-1. Na obstoječih CNC stružnih strojih lahko ponudimo obdelavo: Lastna proizvodnja V podjetju BLAS-TIP vam razen standardnih vijakov izdelamo tudi razno vijačno blago po vaših risbah, skicah ali vzorcih.

en_doc: The child's sixth birthday must fall in the calendar year in which the child is enrolled at school. Knowledge: level 2 Acquires basic general knowledge in the following fields: Slovene (Hungarian, Italian) language; mathematics; foreign language; biology; chemistry; physics; history; geography; citizenship and ethics; art; music; sport; technology; home economics. develops capacity for further educational and vocational development with an emphasis on competences for lifelong learning; is educated for sustainable development and active participation in democratic society, which includes self-knowledge and a responsible attitude towards the self, own health, other people, own and other cultures, the natural and social environment, future generations; Assesment and completion: In the first triad (years 1-3) of elementary school, students' knowledge is assessed using descriptive assessments. In the first triad (years 1-3) of elementary school, students' knowledge is assessed using descriptive assessments. In the first triad (years 1-3) of elementary school, students' knowledge is assessed using descriptive assessments. In the second triad (years 4-6) and third triad (years 7-9) of elementary school, students' knowledge is assessed using numerical grades. In the second triad (years 4-6) and third triad (years 7-9) of elementary school, students' knowledge is assessed using numerical grades. In the second triad (years 4-6) and third triad (years 7-9) of elementary school, students' knowledge is assessed using numerical grades. National assessment National assessment At the end of the second and third triads, students' knowledge is tested by means of national assessment, which is designed to verify the standards of knowledge set out in the curriculum. At the end of the second triad, national assessment is voluntary for students; testing covers the mother tongue (Slovene, Hungarian, Italian), mathematics and a foreign language. At the end of the third triad assessment is compulsory for all students; testing covers the mother tongue (Slovene, Hungarian, Italian), mathematics and a third subject. Progression Progress: Students in the first and second triads do not repeat years. Third-triad students progress to the next year if they achieve a positive assessment in all subjects at the end of the academic year. Transitions Progression: lower vocational education (SQF, level 3), secondary vocational education (SQF, level 4), technical and general secondary education (SQF, level 5) lower vocational education (SQF, level 3), secondary vocational education (SQF, level 4), technical and general secondary education (SQF, level 5) Basic schools issue certificates to students at the end of each year. The certificate is a public document. The basic school leaving certificate contains the student's year 9 grades and the student's results from national assessment at the end of the third triad.

en_doc: Arjan Pregl / Flat Slovenia All artefacts from the Sploščena Slovenija ehbition will be presented, as well as 4 new works of art. And one work is made specially for the Alcatraz Gallery concrete room as a mural painting. The purpose of the exhibition is to point out, through visual art, some problematic aspects of today's social and, most of all, political conditions in Slovenia. Several current subjects are included and presented through different artistic procedures. On one hand, the exhibition will be socially engaged, and on the other I intend to reinterpret some of the ''classical'' manners in art (monochrome painting, series of images, mimicry …) The exhibition is founded on a thesis, that Slovenia is rather flat, than relaxed. Subjects of the exhibition: casualness, equilibrium, intolerant speech of polititians, revision of history, creation of tension … Dual possibility of reading (current political and artistic) is already indicated in the title. - The hunt for communists, 2006, acrylics on canvas, 30 cm x 30 cm - The hunt for communists (next generation), 2007, acrylics on fabric (clothes - jeans), series of 5 paintings of different dimensions I found the inspiration for the painting after seeing the SDS internet forum and how the debate was constantly appealing to communists, the party, Tito (even if the subject was about culture, economics … ) I began to count all these words. One is a lighthouse, therefore an image, which is supposed to, as in opinion of the governing politics, represent Slovenia in the 21st century. The second image is referring to love and slogan (I feel Slovenia), which was chosen by commission, in which as well the polititians had the majority vote. The chosen slogan is in even greater contrariety with the statements, that are constructing the sign. - Monochrome Slovenian abstraction - Urh 2006, 2006, glitter on pleksi glass, series of 4 paintings, each 40 cm x 40 cm The work of art considers the interpretation of history. The entirely monochrome (yellow) paintings represent the façade of a church on Urh. The renewed façade (bright yellow) will cover up the holes in the wall from 1943. It was then, that the partisans conquered the church, which was used as a military post by members of home guard. In the rooms beside, they were interrogating and tormentig partisans, their cooperators and also civilians. I believe that this is the first authentic slovenian monochrome painting. (Minimalistic) repetition, in this case, gains a new meaning. It represents a repetition of a thesis, aiming for that very same thesis to become the only true. Background: In september 2006 programme director of TVS stated, that a television oughts to show a specific measure of državotvornosti. In that time the very same television was broadcasting editorial unworked shots of the TV-broadcast Dnevnik from 1991. Which astonished me, for this forum is probably not used by the II WW fighters, but younger, if not a lot younger people. These were shots, that showed state of political emergency and fight for Slovenia. These shots had powerful emotional charge (of discomfort and fear), that exceeds historical informing. - Instrument for relaxed discreditation, 2006, oil on canvas, (2x) 25 cm x 20 cm Dyptich, on each painting are quotation marks. Some of today's politititans and journalists use quotation marks and with that they are reducing the value of people or events, of which they speak. There have been many appeals, discussions and critiques on this subject (State Department - report 2006, statement of the European Federation of Journalists (EFJ) – 19. 2006, statement of Syndicate of journalist of Slovenia – 13. 2006, Freedom House – report 2006…). The painting describes an image, which could in a really relaxed society be understood as a logo for footwear or clothes. The reports on violations of journalists' autonomy were very insufficient or misleading. I took texts from different journalists' associations, that discuss mentioned subject, and then I crossed off, deleted some words. The text on one side corresponds the original, and on the other, it's meaning is relativised or completely turned upside down. But in Slovenia it gains a totally different meaning. - Sproščena Slovenija/Sploščena Slovenija (Relaxed Slovenia/Flat Slovenia), 2007, pencil on wall, variable dimension The work of art deals with the nowadays often used term sproščenost, regarding to the political and social state in Slovenia. Despite of the fact that many institutions, media and individuals are pointing out that the conditions are different, some polititians and political commentators are persuading and persisting everything is alright. It is a mural painting: several times one after another written words Relaxed, that from a distance seem like a grey (flat) rectangle on a wall. - Suggestion for Slovenia logo I. in II., 2006, plot, 65 cm x 50 cm From the National Assembly completely inappropriate and unacceptable vocabulary is being spread unpunished.
sl_doc: Arjan Pregl / SpLoščena Slovenija Predstavljena bodo vsa dela iz razstave Sploščena Slovenija, kakor tudi 4 nova dela. Eno delo pa je, kot 'stenska poslikava' pripravljena prav za konkreten prostor Galerije ALKATRAZ. Namen razstave je, skozi vizualno umetnost, problematizirati nekatere vidike današnjega družbenega in predvsem političnega stanja v Sloveniji. Z različnimi likovnimi postopki se navezujem na aktualne teme. Po eni strani bo torej razstava družbeno angažirana, po drugi strani pa nameravam reinterpretirati nekatere že 'klasične' prijeme v likovni umetnosti (monokromna slika, nizanje podob, mimikrija…). Razstava temelji na tezi, da je Slovenija bolj spLoščena, kot sproščena. Tematike, ki se jih razstava loteva so: sproščenost, uravnoteženost, nestrpni govor politikov, revidiranje zgodovine, ustvarjanja napetosti… Dvojno možnost branja (torej aktualnopolitično IN likovno) nakazuje že naslov. 2006, akril na platnu, 30 cm x 30 cm - Lov na komuniste (naslednja generacije), 2007, akril na tkanino (oblačila - jeans), serija 5 slik različnih dimenzij Idejo za sliko sem dobil po tem, ko sem na internetnem forumu SDS videl, da se v debati neprestano sklicuje na komuniste, partijo, Tita (tudi če je govora o kulturi, gospodarstvu, …). Lotil sem se štetja teh besed. Ena je svetilnik, torej podoba, ki naj bi, po mnenju vladajoče politike, predstavljala Slovenijo v 21.stoletju. Druga podoba pa se navezuje na ljubezen in na slogan, ki ga je izbrala komisija, v kateri so prav tako imeli večinsko besedo politiki (I feel Slovenija) in je še v bolj očitnem nasprotju z izjavami, ki znak sestavljajo. - Enobarvna slovenska abstrakcija - Urh 2006, 2006, bleščice na pleksi steklu, serija 4 slik, vsaka 40 cm x 40 cm Delo se ukvarja z interpretacijo zgodovine. Popolnoma monokromne (rumene) slike predstavljajo fasado cerkvice na Urhu. Obnovljena fasada (živo rumena) bo prekrila luknje v zidu, ki so nastale leta 1943. Takrat so partizani zavzeli cerkev, ki so jo domoobranci uporabljali za vojaško postojanko in v prostorih zraven zasliševali in mučili partizane, njihove sodelavce in tudi civiliste. Mislim, da gre za prvo avtentično slovensko monokromno sliko. (Minimalistična) repeticija v tem primeru dobi nov pomen. In sicer predstavlja ponavljanje neke teze, z namenom, da bo postala edina resnična. Ozadje: Programski direktor TVS je septembra 2006 izjavil, da mora televizije pokazati določeno mero državotvornosti. V istem času je ista televizija vrtela uredniško neobdelane posnetke oddaje Dnevnik iz leta 1991. Kar me čudi je dejstvo, da tega foruma najbrž ne uporabljajo borci 2. svetovne vojne, ampak mlajši, če ne precej mlajši ljudje. Torej posnetke, ki prikazujejo izredne politične razmere in boje za Slovenijo. Neobdelani posnetki so imeli močan čustven naboj (nelagodnosti in strahu), ki presega zgodovinsko informiranost. - Pripomoček za sproščeno diskreditacijo, 2006, olje na platnu, (2x) 25 cm x 20 cm Diptih, na vsaki sliki je narekovaj. Nekateri današnji politiki in novinarji uporabljajo narekovaje in s tem zmanjšujejo vrednost ljudi ali dogodkov o katerih govorijo. Tej je bilo v zadnjem času posvečenih kar nekaj apelov, okroglih miz in kritik (State Departmenta - poročilo 2006, izjava Evropske zveze novinarjev (EFJ) – 19. 4. 2006, Izjava Sindikata novinarjev Slovenije – 13. 4. 2006, Freedom House - poročilo 2006…). Slika prikazuje podobo, ki bi jo lahko v resnično sproščeni družbi razumeli kot kakšen logotip za obutev ali obleko. Prav poročanje o kršitvah na področju novinarske avtonomije je bilo zelo pomanjkljivo, omalovažujoče ali zavajajoče. Vzel sem besedila različnih novinarskih poklicnih združenj, ki govorijo o omenjeni tematiki, nato pa sem določene dele besedila 'prečrtal'. Besedilo po ena strani ustreza izvirniku, po drugi pa njegov pomen ali popolnoma obrne ali ga relativizira. V Sloveniji pa dobi zelo drugačen pomen. - Sproščena Slovenija/Sploščena Slovenija, 2007, svinčnik na steno, dimenzija variabilna Delo se ukvarja z danes zelo uporabljanim terminom sproščenost, v zvezi z političnim in družbenim stanjem v Sloveniji. Kljub temu, da veliko institucij, medijev in posameznikov opozarja, da je stanje drugačno, pa nekateri politiki in politični komentatorji prepričujejo, da je stanje vse bolj tako, torej sproščeno. Gre za 'stensko poslikavo': za velikokrat zaporedoma napisani besedi Sproščena Slovenija, ki z malo večje razdalje izgleda kot siv (sploščen) pravokotnik na steni. 2006, plot, 65 cm x 50 cm Iz državnega zbora se nekaznovano širi popolnoma neprimeren in nesprejemljiv besednjak, ki vključuje rasistične, ksenofobne in šovinistične izjave.

en_doc: Why and how do they act? The EU's passport-free travel space, known as the Schengen area, is one of the most tangible achievements of European integration. While there is no EU army and defence remains exclusively a matter for member states, the EU has recently taken big steps to boost defence cooperation. Radicalisation is a growing cross-border threat. But what is it, what are the causes and what is the EU doing to prevent it?
sl_doc: Parlament poziva, naj ukrepajo usklajeno in čim prej ponovno vzpostavijo delujoč schengenski prostor. Več v našem intervjuju. Prostor prostega gibanja ljudi, dobrin in kapitala, poznan pod imenom schengen, je eden izmed dosežkov evropske integracije, ki je v našem vsakdanjem življenju najbolj opazen.

en_doc: Dr. Maša Jazbec guest at the event Najpodjetniška ideja (The Best Entrepreneurial Idea) 2020/2021 Location: Online platform ZOOM Head of DDTlab dr. Maša Jazbec will be a guest at the event Najpodjetniška ideja/The Best Entrepreneurial Idea 2021/2021, organized by Akademija Finance, with her lecture Human-Robot. In her lecture, she will present how human-machine interaction occurs via the brain interface and what this brings to the future of the economy. She will highlight issues related to the term humanization of technology, which urges us to ask ourselves about the connection between human and robot: How to direct a robot with an interface using only one’s mind? How to persuade young people to take an interest in robotics? How to harness the potential of the brain?
sl_doc: Novica Maša Jazbec gostja na dogodku Najpodjetniška ideja 2020/2021 Lokacija: Spletna platforma ZOOM Vodja DDTlaba dr. Maša Jazbec bo s predavanjem Človek-robot gostovala na dogodku Najpodjetniška ideja 2021/2021, ki ga organizira Akademija Finance. V svojem predavanju bo predstavila, kako poteka interakcija človeka s strojem preko možganskega vmesnika in kaj to pomeni za prihodnost v gospodarstvu. Izpostavila bo vprašanja, ki so povezana s terminom humanizacija tehnologije in ki nas nagovarjajo, da se sprašujemo o navezavi med človekom in robotom: Kako z vmesnikom z močjo misli usmerjati robota? Kako nagovarjati mlade za robotiko? Kako izrabiti potencial možganov?

en_doc: Jaka I am the founder of the company in charge of field work. You will find me in the apartments or in shops where I take care of purchasing. I’m in charge of cleaning and inventory repairs in the apartments while I often help out our guests with potential technical difficulties. Lately, I have also been helping out at the office to help reduce Nina’s workload. I am very thorough so I will always find flaws or spot areas where improvements could be made. I am the founder of the company in charge of all office duties. I manage the marketing of apartments, take care of accounting and organise the work process and the communication with clients. My phone is my constant companion and even though I would often prefer to just throw it in the lake I will always answer it and help you when you need me. I am very organised and disciplined so expect to receive my replies very quickly. Ažbe I am the youngest member of the company and Nina’s brother. I try to sometimes replace Jaka in the field so you will mostly find me in the apartments where I organise and help with the cleaning process. I’m reliable and flexible so last minute changes never throw me off balance. Together with external co-workers we form the company Agenija d.o.o. Marko and Jana help us in Pokljuka, while we can rely on the hard working Romana to help us clean the apartments in Kranjska Gora and Bled. Whenever you’re in need of someone managing your property or you simply wish to stay in one of our apartments, you can rely on us. We approach each client individually and try to adapt to your needs. Cooperations We are cooperating with the company 24-7, d.o.o. in Kranjska Gora. All our guests are entitled to a discount when renting electric bicycles or going on one of the tours organised by Bike Kekec. Their shop is located at Smerinje 11, 4280 Kranjska Gora. To claim your discount, please email us at: info@agenija.si. We have partnered with the Špica bar and restaurant in Bled to provide breakfast delivery for our guests. sl_doc: Sem ustanovitelj podjetja in sem zadolžen za terensko delo. Našli me boste v apartmajih ali v trgovini, kjer opravljam nabavo. V apartmajih skrbim za popravila inventarja ter za čistočo, večkrat tudi pomagam gostom pri tehničnih težavah. V zadnjem času pogosto priskočim na pomoč tudi v pisarni, kjer razbremenjujem Nino. Sem zelo natančen in vedno bom našel kakšno napako. Sem ustanoviteljica podjetja in zadolžena za vsa pisarniška dela. Urejam trženje apartmajev, računovodstvo in skrbim za organizacijo dela ter komunikacijo s strankami. Telefon je moj zvesti spremljevalec in čeprav bi ga marsikdaj vrgla v jezero, se vam bom vedno oglasila, ko me boste potrebovali. Sem zelo organizirana in disciplinirana, zato boste moje odgovore dobivali ekspresno hitro. Ažbe Sem najmlajši član podjetja in Ninin brat. Sem zanesljiv in fleksibilen, tako da me spremembe v zadnjem hipu nikoli ne spravijo iz tira. Skupaj z zunanjimi sodelavci tvorimo podjetje Agenija d.o.o. Na Pokljuki nam pomagata Marko in Jana, v Kranjski Gori in na Bledu pa imamo marljivo Romano, ki pomaga pri čiščenju. Na nas se lahko obrnete, ko potrebujete nekoga da skrbi za vašo nepremičnino ali ko potrebujete apartma. Do vsake stranke pristopamo osebno in se skušamo prilagoditi željam strank. V Kranjski Gori sodelujemo s podjetjem 24-7, d.o.o. Vsi naši gostje imajo popust na izposojo električnih koles in izlete, ki jih organizira Bike Kekec. Poslovalnica se nahaja na naslovu Smerinje 11, 4280 Kranjska Gora. Za popuste se obrnite na naš email info@agenija.si. Na Bledu sodelujemo z barom in restavracijo Špica, ki za naše goste dostavlja zajtrke. Spletna stran Agenije uporablja analitične piškotke. Če se z njimi strinjate, kliknite sprejmi, v nasprotnem primeru preberite Politiko zasebnosti. Politika zasebnosti Sprejmi

en_doc: I live in Sweden close to Gothenburg but in the countryside in a house with a big garden and close to the forest with great hiking opportunities. At home I have 4 salukis. I bought my first saluki in 1991 and I have showed and competed in Lure-coursing since then. I started with males so I didn’t breed my first litter until 2006. I have bred 6 litters so far under my Kennel name Dahaqin and produced national and international champions, World winners and Specialty Best in Show winners but also Lure-coursing champions. I’m looking forward so much to visit Slovenia and judging at The Euro Sighthound Show, it is a great honor for me.
sl_doc: Živim na podeželju na Švedskem blizu Göteborga, v hiši z velikim vrtom blizu gozda z odličnimi možnostmi za pohodništvo. Doma imam 4 salukije. Prvega sem dobila leta 1991 in od takrat sodelujem na razstavah in tekmah v Lure coursingu. Začela sem s samci, tako da sem prvo leglo imela šele leta 2006. Do zdaj sem v psarni z imenom Dahaqin vzredila šest legel, med katerimi je bilo več nacionalnih in mednarodnih prvakov, svetovnih prvakov in zmagovalcev na specialnih razstavah, pa tudi prvakov v coursingu. Zelo se veselim obiska Slovenije in sojenja na razstavi Eurosighthound, zame bo to velika čast.

en_doc: Between year 1971 and 1979 companies activities were: – pressure casting of non ferrous metals (Al) – transforming of sheet metals – galvanize (Ni, Cr, Zn) – injection – made products from rubber – processing of all kinds of plastic materials On this location today company works since 2001 we have 60 employees in high season we employ 95 people. Company Leplast d.o.o. operates on the market with high quality products of plastics. History The company was founded in 1971.
sl_doc: Podjetje se je v obdobju med letom 1971 in 1979 ukvarjalo s tlačnim litjem (injekcijsko brizganje barvnih kovin, Al), preoblikovanjem pločevine – štancanjem, galvanizacijo (Zn, Ni, Cr), gumarstvom ter brizganjem plastičnih mas. Na današnji lokaciji podjetje deluje od leta 2001, zaposlenih je 60 ljudi, v visoki sezoni do 95 ljudi. Podjetje Leplast d.o.o. na trgu nastopa z visoko kvalitetnimi izdelki iz plastičnih mas. Zgodovina Podjetje je bilo ustanovijeno leta 1971.

en_doc: We will take you by the Mura river, which was once the only source of energy for the local inhabitants. You will be able to look at the preserved mills, including the most famous one, which is still run by the river. That is why our adventure will also include an old-fashioned ride with a boat (if there will be enough water in the river). You will be able to walk around the “Love island”, which offers a lot of wonderful experiences. We will take you through the biggest city in Prekmurje and take a lot at some of the cultural and historical monuments. We will finish our tour with a real culinary experience – a traditional local lunch overlooking the “Sobota lake”. RIDE GORIČKO prepares unforgettable cycling experiences in Prekmurje. Experienced guides with national touring cycling licenses, who grew up with the natural beauties of the hilly Goričko and plain Prekmurje, take you among the vineyards or secret forest paths all the way to the mysterious Mura River. You can choose from a variety of tours – for families, adrenaline-seeking cyclists, team building, etc. While cycling, you discover the beauties of Pomurje, cultural and natural sights and taste local delicacies.
sl_doc: Popeljali vas bomo ob žuboreči reki Muri, ki je v preteklosti bila edini vir energije za tamkajšnje prebivalstvo. Ogledali si boste lahko ohranjene mline na Muri, tudi tistega najbolj znamenitega, ki ga reka še vedno poganja. Zato boste lahko tudi vi celo dvakrat doživeli starodavni način prečkanja reke Mure z brodom, v kolikor bo vode v rečni strugi dovolj. Ogledali si boste lahko Otok ljubezni, ki se imenuje tudi kraj zaljubljencev, ponuja pa še mnogo drugih čudovitih doživetij. Popeljali vas bomo tudi skozi največje prekmursko mesto in predstavili ohranjene kulturne znamenitosti. Konec pa bo seveda zaznamovalo kulinarično doživetje. Pravo prekmursko kosilo s pogledom na ‘Soboško jezero’. RIDE GORIČKO pripravi nepozabna kolesarska doživetja po Prekmurju. Izkušeni vodniki z nacionalnimi licencami turnega kolesarstva, ki so odraščali z naravnimi lepotami gričevnatega Goričkega in ravninskega Prekmurja, vas popeljejo med vinograde ali skrivne gozdne poti vse do skrivnostne reke Mure. Izbirate lahko med raznolikimi turami – za družine, adrenalina željne kolesarje, team buildinge, idr. Ob kolesarjenju odkrivate lepote Pomurja, kulturne in naravne znamenitosti in okušate lokalne dobrote.

en_doc: As a corporate communications as well as graphic design graduate, I started my career in creative corporate marketing and later switched to a large advertising agency. Therefore, I see joining Optiweb as a great opportunity to enrich my digital skills by joining forces with some of the biggest experts in this field. Working on various projects made me realise that I am most interested in digital aspects of marketing, especially as it provides us with so many insights into a buyer’s journey. #1I learned English by watching Cartoon Network as a child. #2I love travelling while also being afraid of flying. How would you explain your job to a 10-year old? Have you ever had to prepare a presentation together with your schoolmates. Travelling without a plan. I like to head into the unknown, discovering new places, people and cultures along the way. I am particularly attracted by remote destinations that require me to get out of my comfort zone. And, of course, by hidden beaches. How do you spend your free time? I love to walk my dog and, at the same time, let myself get immersed in some nail-biter of an audio book. I also like jogging, playing board and video games as well as watching series. What is, in your opinion, a superpower that no project manager can go without? I would say empathy. If we can channel our inner chameleons in conversation, trying to really understand the person on the other side, we can successfully work with just about anyone.
sl_doc: Po izobrazbi sem diplomantka tržnega komuniciranja in grafična oblikovalka. Svojo kariero sem začela v korporativnem marketingu, nadaljevala pa v kreativni oglaševalski agenciji. Pridružitev Optiweb ekipi zato zame predstavlja priložnost, da s sodelovanjem z vrhunskimi strokovnjaki na področju digitalnega marketinga svoje znanje poglobim in nadgradim. Tekom dela na različnih projektih sem ugotovila, da me najbolj zanima tisti digitalni del – predvsem zaradi globine vpogleda, ki jo imamo v potrošnikovo nakupno pot. #1Angleščine sem se kot otrok naučila z gledanjem risank na Cartoon Network. #2Obožujem potovanja, čeprav me je zelo strah letenja … :) Kako bi 10-letniku razložila, kaj delaš v službi? Ste v šoli že delali kakšne seminarske naloge v skupini? Potovanje brez plana. Rada se podam v neznano, vsak dan raziskujem nove kraje, spoznavam nove ljudi in kulturo. Oddaljeni kraji, kjer moram stopiti ven iz lastne cone udobja, me zelo privlačijo, vsekakor pa najbolj uživam na skritih plažah. Kako preživljaš prosti čas? Na sprehodih s psom, kjer se prepustim napeti naraciji avdio knjig. Uživam tudi v teku, igranju družabnih in video iger ter gledanju različnih serij. Kaj misliš, da je nepogrešljiv superpower vodje projektov? Po mojem mnenju je to empatija. Če smo nekoliko “kameleonski” in se znamo postaviti v kožo vsakega sogovorca, mislim, da lahko z vsemi uspešneje sodelujemo.

sl_doc: »V lateks se oblečem, z bičem in petkami te slečem. Ubogal me boš, drugače kaznovan boš. Podrejen, na mizi, blazini ali stolu, privezan s hlačkami, nogavicami, vrvjo ali lisicami, v škornjih te ukrotim in po riti jih vsakemu naložim … Masaža Dominatta vam ponuja 1.000 spektrov fantazijske erotične masaže. Tukaj gre za igro izpolnjevanja gopodaričinih zahtev in zato ste tudi nagrajeni. Z mehkim bičem vas boža in posluša vse vaše želje, zato le zaupajte ji svoje ideje. Maddam vas v dogovoru z vašimi željami tako popelje na več različnih nivojev Dominatte, kjer je lahko vajina igra dominacije prava strastna in čutna izkušnja, vi sami pa določate, do katere stopnje podrejenosti hočete iti. Lahko pa si želite na svoji koži občutiti erotično moč in kaznovanje prave Domine, ki ima izredno zahteven karakter in je primerna za vse tiste, ki želijo Domini služiti kot pravi pravcati suženj. Torej, koliko si bil poreden? Vzburjajoča stimulacija Dominatta erotične masaže vas bo spravila v pravo seksualno vzdušje. Stimulirala bo vse vaše erotične čute do te mere, da bo telo kričalo po »še«. Ste pripravljeni na ta izziv?

en_doc: Abstract: The capability of Special Forces to operate in a complex and unpredictable security environment requires appropriate adjustments in their operation through seeking various combinations of structures and capabilities as well as synergies in dealing with specific tasks. The capability of Special Forces to operate in a complex and unpredictable security environment requires appropriate adjustments in their operation through seeking various combinations of structures and capabilities as well as synergies in dealing with specific tasks. Partial shifts in the integration of women into Special Forces have already been accomplished by some states. Yet, none of these states intend, by no means, to weaken the mission and status of Special Forces through such measures. Based on interviews carried out, the above-stated findings were established in the case of the Special Operation Forces, Slovenian Armed Forces. The trend of integrating women into Special Forces will, hence, remain to depend on the requirements posed by the security environment, which at the same time % is considered to be mainly facilitating the development of Special Forces. Therefore, by integrating the female gender, a significant shift towards a modern understanding of Special Forces is indicated based on their effectiveness when exploiting the capabilities of both genders. Gender integration is tackled by Special Forces in various ways, ranging from the setting-up of all-female special units and mixed-gender teams, to the temporary integration of female force members into the conduct of specific assignments. The final paper notes that although the advantage of gender integration in the conduct of special assignments has been identified, there remains a considerable dilemma with regard to the formation of mixed-gender structures. A similar situation is observable in practice, where despite the formal opportunities, integration of women into Special Forces is still almost nil. The primary concern is to maintain strict physical selection criteria for both genders. These, on one hand, allow members of Special Forces to preserve their status of elite forces within the armed forces, and, on the other hand, reduce their accessibility for a physically weaker gender. Against this background, it has to be emphasized that the problem is related to Special Forces with a prestige global status, where such issues are tackled in a particularly reasoned and processed manner and over a longer period of time.
sl_doc: Opis: Sposobnost delovanja specialnih sil v kompleksnem in nepredvidljivem varnostnem okolju zahteva ustrezne prilagoditve njihovega delovanja, z iskanjem različnih strukturnih in zmogljivostnih kombinacij ter sinergij pri spoprijemanju s posebnimi nalogami.

en_doc: Synopsis Dusha is a young dancer and dance instructor. Torn between a dominant mother, an absent father and a married lover, she is sinking into a typical crisis of the thirties, which gets worse when she starts suspecting that someone has been following her and invading her privacy. She grows increasingly lonesome and exhausted. Even more so, as she realises that her relationship with her married lover has no future. Dusha becomes so lonesome and low-spirited, that she develops a habit of confiding in an anonymous but kind and rather interesting astrologer, who runs a commercial line. Eventually, Dusha matures and makes a decision – she leaves her negligent lover, even though she is carrying his baby. Even her overly self-confident and sexually vibrant mother is preparing for the role of a loving grandmother. This positive change was actually triggered by someone who has been secretly coming beneath Dusha's window for quite a while. Her secret admirer, whom she first regarded as a potential danger and a distasteful voyeur, gradually finds a way to her heart and restores her confidence in the love of a man, and convinces her that there is life after youth, a meaningful life. The unusual admirer does not bring a happy ending, nor an ending of any kind, but offers Dusha a chance to rethink her attitudes toward life and make a fresh start. He tells her a story of a pair of storks, a white female and a black male. It is a tale of love that may or may not exist, but regardless of that, there is no life without it. Dusha realizes that male emotions are too unreliable. She decides to keep the baby, stay friends with her two male friends, and live the life of a single mother.
sl_doc: Duša je mlada plesalka in plesna učiteljica. V razpetosti med dominantno mamo, odsotnim očetom in poročenim ljubimcem se zapleta v krizo tridesetih let, ki se še stopnjuje, ko zasluti, da jo nekdo zasleduje. Vse bolj je osamljena in izčrpana. K temu pripomore tudi utrujen ljubezenski odnos s poročenim ljubimcem, ki prihaja le občasno in vse manj iskreno. Njena samota in potreba po pogovoru sta tako velika, da se občasno pogovarja celo z anonimnim, vendar dovolj zanimivim in prijaznim astrologom. Nato pa Duša dozori in se odloči - odslovi polovičarskega ljubimca, čeprav pričakuje njegovega otroka. Celo super samozavestna in erotično radoživa mama se pripravlja na vlogo ljubeče babice. Vsega pa je v resnici kriv nekdo, ki je že nekaj časa skrivaj prihajal pod njeno okno. Zaljubljeni vasovalec se iz anonimne nevarnosti in voajerske neokusnosti uspešno približuje njenemu srcu, vrača ji upanje v moško ljubezen in smisel življenja onkraj mladosti. Nenavadni vasovalec s seboj ne prinese srečnega konca, sploh nikakršnega konca - samo priložnost, da življenje na novo premisli in ga morda začne drugače. Pove ji zgodbo o beli štorklji in črnem štrku, zgodbo o ljubezni, ki morda je, morda ni, pa vendar brez nje ni mogoče živeti. Duša ugotovi, da so moška čustva preveč nezanesljiva. Odloči se imeti otroka, ohraniti dva prijatelja in ostati sama.

en_doc: If you have not logged in, you will be identified by your network IP address. This is a series of four numbers which identifies the Internet address from which you are contacting the wiki. If you are logged in, you will be identified by your user name. This may be your real name if you so choose, or you may choose to publish under a pseudonym, whatever user name you selected when you created your account.
sl_doc: V primeru, da kot uporabnik niste prijavljeni v sistem, vas bo sistem identificiral po vaši številki IP. To je zaporedje štirih števil, ki določa internetni naslov, s katerega uporabnik komunicira s stranjo www.coks.si. Ko je uporabnik prijavljen, ga sistem identificira preko uporabniškega imena. To je lahko uporabnikovo pravo ime ali pa psevdonim, ki si ga je uporabnik izbral ob prijavi.

en_doc: 8 For if a man should live many years, let him enjoy them all.+ But he should remember that the days of darkness may be many; all that is to come is futility.+ 9 Rejoice, young man, while you are young, and let your heart be glad in the days of your youth. Follow the ways of your heart and go where your eyes lead you; but know that the true God will bring you into judgment* for all these things.+ 10 So remove troublesome things from your heart, and ward off harmful things from your body,* for youth and the prime of life are futility.+
sl_doc: Vsak dan, ki prihaja, je ničevost.+ 9 Mladenič, veseli+ se v svoji mladosti in naj bo tvoje srce radostno v tvojih mladih dneh. Hodi po poteh svojega srca in za tistim, kar gledajo tvoje oči.+ Toda vedi, da te bo pravi Bog zaradi vsega tega privedel na sodbo.+ 10 Zato odstrani zaskrbljenost iz svojega srca in odpravi nesrečo od svojega telesa,+ kajti mladost in cvet življenja sta ničevost.+

The path to the beginning of the descent takes us along the old Italian mule track. From here the adventure is guaranteed. We will overcome them sliding down the rear side or jumping into the crystal clear pools or with the help of ropes. Waterfalls are a natural waterslides. We will overcome them sliding down the rear side or jumping into the crystal clear pools or with the help of ropes. In a fun, dynamic and unique way, we will learn about the work of nature. rental of equipment required for zipline and canyoning (helmet, harness kit, cord and pulley, gloves, neoprene shoes, neoprene wetsuit 5mm top and bottom, protective pants, undercap)
sl_doc: Paketi doživetij ZIP & RAFTING V tem paketu sta združeni dve najbolj priljubljeni aktivnosti: zipline in rafting na Soči. V tem paketu si zagotovite dve najbolj adrenalinski izkušnji v dolini Soče: zipline spust po desetih jeklenicah, zatem pa kanjoning po slapovih soteske Sušec. Po nekaterih slapovih se bomo dričali po zadnji plati, nekatere bomo premagali s skokom v kristalno čiste tolmune, večje pa s pomočjo vrvi. Na zabaven, dinamičen in svojstven način bomo spoznavali tisočletno delo narave. izposojo obvezne zaščitne opreme za kanjoning (neoprenska obleka 5 mm sp.del in zgornji del, zaščitne hlače, neoprenski copati, varovalni pas, podkapa, čelada) in zipline (varovalni pas, čelada, rokavice) Po nekaterih slapovih se bomo dričali po zadnji plati, nekatere bomo premagali s skokom v kristalno čiste tolmune, večje pa s pomočjo vrvi.

en_doc: Regarding working time, the law prescribes that: Workers under the age of 18 have the right to additional seven working days of annual leave. IF YOU ARE BETWEEN 15 AND 18 YEARS OLD, you are surely capable of performing harder work than the work that can be performed by workers younger than you (look at the list of less demanding work under Primary school children heading (above the age of 13)). However, pay particular attention and think well before you carry out a particular work task. Students, according to European statistical data, the frequency of injuries at work in workers between 18 and 24 years of age is by 50 per cent higher than in other age groups. Secondary school pupils and students undertaking a work practice or wishing to earn some money during summer holidays should know that the employer has to ensure them the same level of safety and health at work as he does to the regularly employed workers. REMEMBER: The employer has a duty to ensure that you work safely and without risk to health, while you must follow his instructions. The employer has a duty to find out what may jeopardise your safety and health in the workplace, assess the risks and take preventive measures. A hazard is everything that may cause an injury or a disease. Talk to your superiors or parents (particularly if you are under age) if you have any doubts about the safety of your work. Safety and health of the workers who have not yet reached the age of 18 The law stipulates that workers under the age of 18 shall enjoy special protection in their employment relationship. If a worker has not yet reached the age of 18, special rights or work restrictions apply to him. Such workers may not carry out the following work:
sl_doc: O delovnem času piše, da: Delavci imajo do dopolnjenega 18. leta starosti pravico do dodatnih 7 delovnih dni dopusta. ČE SI STAR MED 15 IN 18 LET, si seveda sposoben opravljati težja dela od tistih, ki jih lahko opravljajo mlajši od tebe (poglej spisek lažjih del pod rubriko osnovnošolci (nad 13 let starosti)). Vendar pa bodi pri tem pozoren in pazljiv, ter dobro razmisli, preden narediš določeno delovno nalogo. Študentje, po evropskih statističnih podatkih je pogostost poškodb pri delu med delavci, ki so stari med 18 in 24 let, za 50% višja kot pri drugih starostnih skupinah. Dijaki in študentje, ki opravljate delovno prakso ali želite med poletnimi počitnicami zaslužiti nekaj denarja, morate vedeti, da vam mora delodajalec zagotoviti enako stopnjo varnosti in zdravja pri delu kot redno zaposlenim delavcem. ZAPOMNI SI: Delodajalec mora poskrbeti za tvoje varno in zdravju neškodljivo delo, ti pa moraš upoštevati njegova navodila. Delodajalec mora ugotoviti, kaj lahko ogrozi tvojo varnost in zdravje na delovnem mestu, oceniti tveganja in izvesti preventivne ukrepe. Nevarnost je vse tisto, kar lahko povzroči poškodbo ali bolezen. O vsakem pomisleku v zvezi z varnostjo tvojega dela se posvetuj z nadrejenimi in starši (predvsem, če si še mladoleten). Varnost in zdravje delavcev, ki še niso dopolnili 18 let starosti Zakon pravi, da delavci, ki še niso dopolnili 18 let starosti, uživajo v delovnem razmerju posebno varstvo. Če delavec še ni dopolnil 18 let, veljajo zanj posebne pravice oziroma omejitve glede dela. Ti delavci ne smejo opravljati naslednjih del:

en_doc: I am planning to travel to Cuba from Brussels and have been asked by friends to bring back cigars for them. Can I do this as my understanding is that such imports must be for "personal use"? Imports are regarded as being for personal use if they take place occasionally, are goods to be used by you or your family or which are intended as presents. I am going on holiday from Ireland to Lanzarote. YES - as long as you don't exceed the limits of such goods for personal use, you can import them from the Canary Islands, free of customs duties, VAT and excise duties. If I go to another EU country with a cheque for more than €10,000, do I have to declare this or do I have to declare only cash amounts in excess of €10,000? When you enter or leave the EU with € 10 000 or more in cash (or its equivalent in other currencies), and/or any other financial/monetary instrument that can be transferred anonymously from one person to another you must declare it to the customs authorities by using the EU cash declaration form. When you travel within the EU you might have a similar obligation, as intra-EU cash controls are also applied in some EU countries. Is it necessary to declare the importation of gold or precious stones to the value of more than €10,000? NO - gold, precious metals and precious stones do not have to be declared under the EU cash control rules. However, these items are covered under customs laws and specific national rules may apply.
sl_doc: Načrtujem potovanje na Kubo, kamor bom letel iz Bruslja. Je to dovoljeno? Če prav razumem, je takšen uvoz možen le za osebno uporabo. Šteje se, da so izdelki namenjeni za osebno uporabo, če jih uvozite občasno ter so namenjeni vam osebno, vaši družini ali za darila. Iz Irske se odpravljam na dopust na otok Lanzarote. Ali lahko nazaj prinesem nekatere izdelke brez plačila carine? DA – Takšno blago, namenjeno osebni uporabi, s Kanarskih otokov lahko uvozite brez plačila carine, DDV in trošarin. Če potujem v drugo državo EU s čekom v vrednosti več kot 10 000 evrov, ali moram to prijaviti ali je treba prijaviti samo gotovino v vrednosti nad 10 000 evrov? Če vstopate v Evropsko unijo ali izstopate iz nje z 10 000 EUR gotovine ali več (oziroma z enakovrednim zneskom v drugi valuti) in/ali v obliki katerega koli drugega finančnega/denarnega instrumenta, ki se lahko anonimno prenese z ene osebe na drugo, morate to prijaviti carinskim organom z obrazcem za prijavo gotovine. Podobna obveznost lahko velja, kadar potujete po Evropski uniji, saj se v nekaterih državah članicah izvaja tudi nadzor gotovine znotraj EU. Ali je treba prijaviti uvoz zlata ali dragih kamnov v vrednosti več kot 10 000 evrov? NE – V skladu s pravili EU o nadzoru gotovine ni treba prijaviti uvoza zlata, plemenitih kovin in dragih kamnov, vendar to področje ureja carinska zakonodaja in lahko veljajo tudi nacionalni predpisi.

en_doc: Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Community, and in particular Article 61(c) and Article 67(1) thereof, (1) The Community has set itself the objective of maintaining and developing an area of freedom, security and justice, in which the free movement of persons is ensured. In order to establish progressively such an area, the Community should adopt, amongst other things, the measures relating to judicial cooperation in civil matters which are necessary for the sound operation of the internal market. (6) In order to attain the objective of free movement of judgments in civil and commercial matters, it is necessary and appropriate that the rules governing jurisdiction and the recognition and enforcement of judgments be governed by a Community legal instrument which is binding and directly applicable. (7) The scope of this Regulation must cover all the main civil and commercial matters apart from certain well-defined matters. (12) In addition to the defendant's domicile, there should be alternative grounds of jurisdiction based on a close link between the court and the action or in order to facilitate the sound administration of justice. (17) By virtue of the same principle of mutual trust, the procedure for making enforceable in one Member State a judgment given in another must be efficient and rapid. (20) The United Kingdom and Ireland, in accordance with Article 3 of the Protocol on the position of the United Kingdom and Ireland annexed to the Treaty on European Union and to the Treaty establishing the European Community, have given notice of their wish to take part in the adoption and application of this Regulation. (21) Denmark, in accordance with Articles 1 and 2 of the Protocol on the position of Denmark annexed to the Treaty on European Union and to the Treaty establishing the European Community, is not participating in the adoption of this Regulation, and is therefore not bound by it nor subject to its application. The Regulation shall not apply to: A person domiciled in a Member State may, in another Member State, be sued: Council Regulation (EC) No 44/2001 of 22 December 2000 on jurisdiction and the recognition and enforcement of judgments in civil and commercial matters Council Regulation (EC) No 44/2001 of 22 December 2000 on jurisdiction and the recognition and enforcement of judgments in civil and commercial matters Council Regulation (EC) No 44/2001 of 22 December 2000 on jurisdiction and the recognition and enforcement of judgments in civil and commercial matters Council Regulation (EC) No 44/2001 of 22 December 2000 on jurisdiction and the recognition and enforcement of judgments in civil and commercial matters An applicant who, in the Member State of origin has benefited from complete or partial legal aid or exemption from costs or expenses, shall be entitled, in the procedure provided for in this Section, to benefit from the most favourable legal aid or the most extensive exemption from costs or expenses provided for by the law of the Member State addressed. No security, bond or deposit, however described, shall be required of a party who in one Member State applies for enforcement of a judgment given in another Member State on the ground that he is a foreign national or that he is not domiciled or resident in the State in which enforcement is sought. Judgments given in other Member States by virtue of Article 6(2), or Article 11 shall be recognised and enforced in Germany and Austria in accordance with Chapter III. Article 75 The Commission shall be assisted by a committee. This Regulation shall enter into force on l March 2002. This Regulation is binding in its entirety and directly applicable in the Member States in accordance with the Treaty establishing the European Community. (32) Ker države članice ne morejo v zadostni meri doseči ciljev te uredbe in jih je zato lažje doseči na ravni Skupnosti, lahko Skupnost te ukrepe sprejme v skladu z načelom subsidiarnosti iz člena 5 Pogodbe. Ta uredba se uporablja ne glede na vrsto sodišča v civilnih zadevah, ki se nanašajo na: "sodna odločba" pomeni odločbo o razvezi, prenehanju življenjske skupnosti ali razveljavitvi zakonske zveze, kakor tudi sodno odločbo, ki se nanaša na starševsko odgovornost, in jo je izdalo sodišče države članice, ne glede na to, kakšno je ime sodne odločbe, vključno s sklepom, odredbo ali odločbo; (a) je to kršitev pravic do varstva in vzgoje, pridobljenih s sodno odločbo ali po samem zakonu ali z dogovorom, ki ima pravno veljavo v skladu z zakonodajo države članice, v kateri je imel otrok običajno prebivališče neposredno pred premestitvijo ali zadržanjem; Člen 7 Subsidiarna pristojnost Kadar po členih 3, 4 in 5 ni pristojno nobeno sodišče države članice, se pristojnost v vsaki državi članici določi v skladu z zakonodajo te države. ob upoštevanju Pogodbe o ustanovitvi Evropske skupnosti in zlasti člena 61(c) in člena 67(1) Pogodbe, (1) Evropska skupnost si je zastavila cilj oblikovati območje svobode, varnosti in pravice, v katerem je zagotovljen prost pretok oseb. Drugo sodišče v takšnem primeru ne sme imeti možnosti prenesti zadeve na katero koli tretje sodišče. (32) Ker države članice ne morejo v zadostni meri doseči ciljev te uredbe in jih je zato lažje doseči na ravni Skupnosti, lahko Skupnost te ukrepe sprejme v skladu z načelom subsidiarnosti iz člena 5 Pogodbe. "država članica izvora" pomeni državo članico, kjer je bila izdana sodna odločba, ki jo je treba izvršiti; Kadar oseba, institucija ali drug organ, ki ima pravico do varstva in vzgoje otroka, zahteva od pristojnih organov v državi članici, da izdajo sodno odločbo na podlagi Haaške konvencije z dne 25. oktobra 1980 o civilnopravnih vidikih mednarodne ugrabitve otrok (v nadaljnjem besedilu "Haaška konvencija iz leta 1980"), da bi dosegla vrnitev otroka, ki je bil neupravičeno premeščen ali zadržan v drugi državi članici, ki ni država članica, kjer je običajno prebival neposredno pred neupravičeno premestitvijo ali zadržanjem, se uporabljata odstavka 2 do 8. (a) izvod sodne odločbe, ki izpolnjuje pogoje, potrebne za potrditev njegove verodostojnosti; [1] Uredba Sveta (ES) št. 2201/2003 z dne 27. novembra 2003 o pristojnosti in priznavanju ter izvrševanju sodnih odločb v zakonskih sporih in sporih v zvezi s starševsko odgovornostjo ter o razveljavitvi Uredbe (ES) št. 1347/2000. Podpis in/ali žig [1] Uredba Sveta (ES) št. 2201/2003 z dne 27. novembra 2003 o pristojnosti in priznavanju ter izvrševanju sodnih odločb v zakonskih sporih in sporih v zvezi s starševsko odgovornostjo ter o razveljavitvi Uredbe (ES) št. 1347/2000. Ukrepe, ki se nanašajo na otrokovo premoženje, vendar niso povezani z varstvom otroka, še naprej ureja Uredba Sveta (ES) št. 44/2001 z dne 22. decembra 2000 o pristojnosti in priznavanju ter izvrševanju sodnih odločb v civilnih in gospodarskih zadevah [7]. (31) Danska v skladu s členoma 1 in 2 Protokola o stališču Danske, ki je priložen Pogodbi o Evropski uniji in Pogodbi o ustanovitvi Evropske skupnosti, ne sodeluje pri sprejemanju te uredbe, zato je ta uredba ne obvezuje in se zanjo ne uporablja. Odstavek 1 se ne uporablja, če nosilec pravic do stikov z otrokom iz odstavka 1 sprejme pristojnost sodišč države članice novega otrokovega običajnega prebivališča s tem, da se udeležuje postopkov pred temi sodišči, ne da bi izpodbijal njihovo pristojnost. Določbe te uredbe v nujnih primerih sodiščem države članice ne preprečujejo sprejetja začasnih ukrepov ali ukrepov zavarovanja glede v tej državi nahajajočih se oseb ali premoženja, ki jih predvideva pravo te države članice, tudi v primeru, ko je po tej uredbi za odločanje o glavni stvari pristojno sodišče druge države članice. (d) na zahtevo osebe, ki zatrjuje, da sodna odločba posega v njeno starševsko odgovornost, če je bila izdana, ne da bi bila tej osebi dana možnost zaslišanja; (g) če ni bil upoštevan postopek, ki ga določa člen 56. Take izjave se priložijo tej uredbi in se objavijo v Uradnem listu Evropskih skupnosti. (20) Zaslišanje otroka v drugi državi članici lahko poteka v skladu z ureditvijo, ki jo določa Uredba Sveta (ES) št. 1206/2001 z dne 28. maja 2001 o sodelovanju med sodišči držav članic pri pridobivanju dokazov v civilnih ali gospodarskih zadevah [9]. (27) Ukrepe, potrebne za izvajanje te uredbe, je treba sprejeti v skladu s Sklepom Sveta 1999/468/ES z dne 28. junija 1999 o določitvi postopkov za uresničevanje Komisiji podeljenih izvedbenih pooblastil [11]. PODROČJE UPORABE IN OPREDELITVE Z dnem začetka uporabe te uredbe se razveljavi Uredba (ES) št. 1347/2000. [2] Mnenje z 20. septembra 2002 (še neobjavljeno v Uradnem listu). (6) Ker se vprašanje uporabe pravil o starševski odgovornosti pogosto pojavi v okviru postopkov v zvezi z zakonskimi spori, je bolj ustrezno imeti en sam instrument za zadeve, povezane z razvezo in starševsko odgovornostjo. Ukrepe, ki se nanašajo na otrokovo premoženje, vendar niso povezani z varstvom otroka, še naprej ureja Uredba Sveta (ES) št. 44/2001 z dne 22. decembra 2000 o pristojnosti in priznavanju ter izvrševanju sodnih odločb v civilnih in gospodarskih zadevah [7]. "sodnik" pomeni sodnika ali uradno osebo, ki ima enaka pooblastila kot sodnik v zadevah s področja uporabe te uredbe; "država članica" pomeni vse države članice z izjemo Danske; "sodna odločba" pomeni odločbo o razvezi, prenehanju življenjske skupnosti ali razveljavitvi zakonske zveze, kakor tudi sodno odločbo, ki se nanaša na starševsko odgovornost, in jo je izdalo sodišče države članice, ne glede na to, kakšno je ime sodne odločbe, vključno s sklepom, odredbo ali odločbo; Najkasneje 1. januarja 2012 in nato vsakih pet let predloži Komisija Evropskemu parlamentu, Svetu in Evropskemu ekonomsko-socialnemu odboru poročilo o uporabi te direktive na podlagi podatkov, ki jih dajo države članice. Poročilu se priložijo po potrebi predlogi za spremembe. ob upoštevanju Pogodbe o ustanovitvi Evropske skupnosti in zlasti člena 61(c) in člena 67(1) Pogodbe, (1) Evropska skupnost si je zastavila cilj oblikovati območje svobode, varnosti in pravice, v katerem je zagotovljen prost pretok oseb. V ta namen mora Skupnost med drugim sprejeti tudi ukrepe na področju pravosodnega sodelovanja v civilnih zadevah, potrebne za pravilno delovanje notranjega trga. (6) Ker se vprašanje uporabe pravil o starševski odgovornosti pogosto pojavi v okviru postopkov v zvezi z zakonskimi spori, je bolj ustrezno imeti en sam instrument za zadeve, povezane z razvezo in starševsko odgovornostjo. (7) Področje uporabe te uredbe obsega civilne zadeve, ne glede na vrsto sodišča. (21) Priznavanje in izvrševanje sodnih odločb, izrečenih v državi članici, mora temeljiti na načelu medsebojnega zaupanja, razloge za nepriznanje pa je treba omejiti na kar najmanjši obseg. (30) Združeno kraljestvo in Irska sta v skladu s členom 3 Protokola o stališču Združenega kraljestva in Irske, ki je priložen Pogodbi o Evropski uniji in Pogodbi o ustanovitvi Evropske skupnosti, podali obvestilo, da želita sodelovati pri sprejetju in uporabi te uredbe. (31) Danska v skladu s členoma 1 in 2 Protokola o stališču Danske, ki je priložen Pogodbi o Evropski uniji in Pogodbi o ustanovitvi Evropske skupnosti, ne sodeluje pri sprejemanju te uredbe, zato je ta uredba ne obvezuje in se zanjo ne uporablja. Ta uredba se ne uporablja za: Uredba Sveta (ES) št. 2201/2003 z dne 27. novembra 2003 o pristojnosti in priznavanju ter izvrševanju sodnih odločb v zakonskih sporih in sporih v zvezi s starševsko odgovornostjo ter o razveljavitvi Uredbe (ES) št. 1347/2000 Uredba Sveta (ES) št. 2201/2003 z dne 27. novembra 2003 o pristojnosti in priznavanju ter izvrševanju sodnih odločb v zakonskih sporih in sporih v zvezi s starševsko odgovornostjo ter o razveljavitvi Uredbe (ES) št. 1347/2000 Če je bila vlagatelju zahteve v državi članici izvora odobrena popolna ali delna brezplačna pravna pomoč ali oprostitev stroškov postopka, je ta upravičen v postopku iz členov 21, 28, 41, 42 in 48 do kar najširše brezplačne pravne pomoči ali oprostitve stroškov postopka, ki ju dopušča pravo države članice izvršitve. Varščina ali depozit Od stranke, ki v eni od držav članic vloži zahtevo za izvršitev sodne odločbe, izdane v drugi državi članici, ni dovoljeno zahtevati nobene oblike varščine ali depozita iz naslednjih razlogov: Za priznanje odločb iz odstavka 2 lahko v Španiji in Italiji veljajo isti postopki in ista preverjanja, kot se uporabljajo za odločbe cerkvenih sodišč, ki so izdane v skladu z mednarodnimi pogodbami iz odstavka 3, sklenjenimi s Svetim sedežem. Komisiji pomaga odbor (v nadaljevanju "odbor"). Ta uredba začne veljati 1. avgusta 2004. Ta uredba je v celoti zavezujoča in se neposredno uporablja v državah članicah v skladu s Pogodbo o ustanovitvi Evropske skupnosti. Imena strank, ki se jim je nudila pravna pomoč Drugo sodišče v takšnem primeru ne sme imeti možnosti prenesti zadeve na katero koli tretje sodišče. (14) Ta uredba mora učinkovati brez poseganja v uporabo mednarodnega javnega prava glede diplomatske imunitete. Kadar izvrševanje pristojnosti na podlagi te uredbe ni mogoče zaradi obstoja diplomatske imunitete v skladu z mednarodnim pravom, je treba pristojnost izvrševati v skladu z nacionalno zakonodajo države članice, v kateri zadevna oseba nima takšne imunitete. (21) Priznavanje in izvrševanje sodnih odločb, izrečenih v državi članici, mora temeljiti na načelu medsebojnega zaupanja, razloge za nepriznanje pa je treba omejiti na kar najmanjši obseg. (22) Javne listine in dogovore med strankami, ki so izvršljivi v eni državi članici, je treba za namene uporabe pravil o priznavanju in izvrševanju obravnavati kot enakovredne "sodnim odločbam". (23) Evropski svet v Tampereju je v svojih sklepih (točka 34) upošteval, da je treba sodne odločbe z družinskopravnega področja "avtomatično priznavati v vsej Uniji, brez kakršnih koli vmesnih postopkov ali razlogov za zavrnitev izvršitve". (24) Zoper potrdilo, izdano za lažjo izvršitev sodne odločbe, ni pravnega sredstva. Pri neupravičeni premestitvi ali zadržanju otroka sodišča države članice, v kateri je otrok običajno prebival neposredno pred neupravičeno premestitvijo ali zadržanjem, obdržijo svojo pristojnost, dokler otrok ne pridobi običajnega prebivališča v drugi državi članici in: (iii) primer pred sodiščem v državi članici, kjer je otrok običajno prebival neposredno pred neupravičeno premestitvijo ali zadržanjem, je bil zaključen na podlagi člena 11(7); (iv) sodno odločbo o varstvu in vzgoji otroka, ki ne nalaga vrnitve otroka, so izdala sodišča države članice, kjer je otrok običajno prebival neposredno pred neupravičeno premestitvijo ali zadržanjem. (32) Ker države članice ne morejo v zadostni meri doseči ciljev te uredbe in jih je zato lažje doseči na ravni Skupnosti, lahko Skupnost te ukrepe sprejme v skladu z načelom subsidiarnosti iz člena 5 Pogodbe.

en_doc: Corporate Security Magazine The Corporate Security Magazine is also available online. This will further expand the range of users and readers, which is of utmost importance in the context of raising awareness of the need for comprehensive management of security risks. The latest issue of the Corporate security magazin Mitja Štular, Member of the Management Board of Telekom Slovenije; Interview: Božidar Dajčman, recipient of the Corporate Security Manager of the Year award; Article - Ana Hožič: New European regulations regarding the use of drones; Article - Gordan Sket: Information Security Challenges in the OT Environment… Uporabljamo piškotke
sl_doc: "Slovenska velika nagrada varnosti" oziroma "Slovenian Grand Security Award" je najpomembnejša nagrada s področja varnosti v Republiki Sloveniji, ki se podeljuje izbranim institucijam in posameznikom za njihov inovativni prispevek na področju razvoja in uveljavljanja varnosti. Kibernetska varnost V okviru ICS Ljubljana deluje Center za informacijsko varnost, ki se ukvarja s področjem kibernetske varnosti - testiranjem v IT okoljih, penetracijskimi (vdornimi) testiranji in varnostnimi pregledi. Hkrati ponujamo tudi izobraževanje z naslovom "Osnovni vidiki kibernetske varnosti". Identificiramo in izvajamo vse potrebne sistemske ukrepe za obvladovanje varnostnih tveganj v posameznem podjetju. Korporativna varnost je ena od osnovnih funkcij, ki zagotavlja učinkovito delovanje podjetja. V tej številki boste našli: Intervju – g. Dimitrij Zadel, predsednik uprave Luka Koper; Intervju – dr. Mitja Štular, član uprave Telekom Slovenije; Intervju: Božidar Dajčman, prejemnik nagrade Korporativni varnostni manager leta; članek – Ana Hožič: Novi evropski predpisi v zvezi z uporabo brezpilotnih zrakoplovov (dronov); članek - Gordan Sket: Izzivi informacijske varnosti v okolju OT … V okviru inštituta deluje Slovensko združenje korporativne varnosti, ki združuje pravne in fizične osebe s področja korporativne varnosti in drugih povezanih področij. Dogodek so organizirali Institut za korporativne varnostne študije, Slovensko združenje korporativne varnosti in SE Europe Corporate Security Association (SEECSA). Podelitev se je zgodila 26. maja 2021 v okviru mednarodne konference Dnevi korporativne varnosti. Dogodek so organizirali Institut za korporativne varnostne študije, Slovensko združenje korporativne varnosti in SE Europe Corporate Security Association (SEECSA). "Slovenska velika nagrada varnosti" oziroma "Slovenian Grand Security Award" je najpomembnejša nagrada s področja varnosti v Republiki Sloveniji, ki se podeljuje izbranim institucijam in posameznikom za njihov inovativni prispevek na področju razvoja in uveljavljanja varnosti. Korporativna varnost Zadnja številka revije Korporativna varnost Mitja Štular, član uprave Telekom Slovenije; Intervju: Božidar Dajčman, prejemnik nagrade Korporativni varnostni manager leta; članek – Ana Hožič: Novi evropski predpisi v zvezi z uporabo brezpilotnih zrakoplovov (dronov); članek - Gordan Sket: Izzivi informacijske varnosti v okolju OT …

sl_doc: Navodila za uporabo QR kode za BOŠTJAN KRAMAR S.P. S svojim mobilnim telefonom skenirajte kodo na ekranu. To storite tako, da na telefonu odprete skenirno aplikacijo, kamero telefona usmerite v kodo na ekranu in počakajte par sekund. Navodila za uporabo QR kode za BIROELEKTRONIK d.o.o.

en_doc: In newspaper reading room located on the second floor (Department of Local Studies) you can choose from 100 Slovenian and foreign periodical publications. More recent editions are on a free approach section whereas older editions will be brought to you from depots. Those can be accessed through digital library system. There is also a big reading room located on the 3rd floor. It has 50 seats and is available to all users who want to read or study in complete silence. Founder
sl_doc: V časopisni čitalnici, ki se nahaja v drugem nadstropju domoznanskega oddelka, lahko izbirate med 100 domačimi in tujimi periodičnimi publikacijami. Zadnji letniki so prosto dostopni, medtem ko vam starejše izvode knjižničarji na željo prinesejo iz skladišča. Najdete jih v naši digitalni knjižnici. Študijska čitalnica je prostor, kjer boste lahko študirali v miru in tišini. Namenjena je vsem obiskovalcem in se nahaja v tretjem nadstropju knjižnice, kjer je na voljo 50 sedežev.

en_doc: amending Implementing Regulation (EU) No 282/2011 as regards supplies of goods or services facilitated by electronic interfaces and the special schemes for taxable persons supplying services to non-taxable persons, making distance sales of goods and certain domestic supplies of goods Whereas: Directive 2006/112/EC was amended by Council Directive (EU) 2017/2455 (2) which, inter alia, extended the scope of the special schemes for non-established taxable persons supplying telecommunications, broadcasting or electronic services to non-taxable persons to all types of services as well as to intra-Community distance sales of goods and distance sales of goods imported from third territories or third countries. Directive (EU) 2017/2455 also introduced certain provisions for taxable persons facilitating supplies of goods or services made by other taxable persons through the use of an electronic interface such as a marketplace, platform, portal or similar means. The detailed provisions for the application of those special schemes laid down in Council Implementing Regulation (EU) No 282/2011 (3) should be updated following the extension of their scope. The definitions of ‘intra-Community distance sales of goods’ and ‘distance sales of goods imported from third territories or third countries’ in Directive 2006/112/EC also cover supplies of goods where the supplier intervenes indirectly in their dispatch or transport to the customer. Therefore, to ensure the correct and uniform application of those definitions across Member States and to enhance legal certainty for both economic operators and tax administrations, it is necessary to clarify and define the meaning of the term ‘indirectly’ in this context. In order to ensure the uniform application across Member States of the provisions concerning taxable persons facilitating supplies of goods and services in the Community and to improve legal certainty for taxable persons subject to value added tax (VAT) rules and for tax admininstrations that enforce those rules, it is necessary to further define the meaning of the term ‘facilitates’ and to clarify when a taxable person is not considered to facilitate supplies of goods or services through an electronic interface. In order to ensure the uniform application of the VAT rules, it is necessary to clearly define the moment when the payment by the customer can be considered to be accepted so as to determine in which taxable period supplies by taxable persons facilitating supplies of goods in the Community through the use of an electronic interface or by any taxable person making use of the special scheme for distance sales of goods imported from third territories or third countries have to be declared. It is necessary to determine which type of information should be kept in the records of taxable persons facilitating supplies of goods and services in the Community through an electronic interface. This should take account of the nature of the information available to such taxable persons, its relevance for tax administrations and the requirement that such accounting and record-keeping be proportionate in order to comply with the rights and obligations laid down in Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council (4). A taxable person facilitating certain supplies of goods in the Community through the use of an electronic interface is deemed to have received and supplied the goods himself and is liable to pay VAT on these supplies. It is important to take into account that such a taxable person may be dependent on the accuracy of the information provided by the suppliers selling goods through that electronic interface to correctly declare and pay the amount of VAT due. It is therefore reasonable to provide that, when the information received is erroneous, such a taxable person shall not be held liable for any amount of VAT in excess of the VAT which he declared and paid on these supplies where he can demonstrate that he did not and could not reasonably have known that the information received was incorrect. This should allow Member States to release those taxable persons from additional VAT liability where they act in good faith. This should allow Member States to release those taxable persons from additional VAT liability where they act in good faith. In order to reduce the administrative burden on taxable persons facilitating certain supplies of goods in the Community through the use of an electronic interface, it is appropriate to release them from the burden of having to prove the status of the seller and customer. In order to reduce the administrative burden on taxable persons facilitating certain supplies of goods in the Community through the use of an electronic interface, it is appropriate to release them from the burden of having to prove the status of the seller and customer. Therefore certain rebuttable presumptions should be introduced whereby suppliers selling goods through that electronic interface are presumed to be taxable persons and their customers non-taxable persons. To avoid doubt, it is necessary to specify that the identification number allocated to an intermediary acting in the name and on behalf of a taxable person using the import scheme is an authorisation enabling him to act as intermediary and cannot be used by the intermediary to declare VAT on taxable transactions that he carries out himself. The provision excluding a taxable person who voluntarily ceased using a special scheme from re-entering that special scheme for a period of two calendar quarters is not considered useful by Member States and may create additional burdens for the taxable person concerned. In addition, as corrections to previous VAT returns will have to be submitted in a subsequent return for tax periods as of 1 January 2021, taxable persons excluded from a special scheme will no longer be able to make corrections in a subsequent return. As a consequence, it is necessary to provide that such corrections should be discharged directly with the tax authorities of the relevant Member States of consumption. As the name of the customer must only be kept in the records of a taxable person making use of a special scheme if available to that taxable person, is not needed to determine the Member State in which the supply is subject to VAT and may raise data protection issues, it is no longer necessary to include the name of the customer in the records to be kept by taxable persons making use of a special scheme. However, to facilitate the control of supplies of goods covered by a special scheme, it is necessary to include information on returns of goods and consignment or transaction numbers amongst the information to be kept by taxable persons. In order to ensure consistency between the special arrangements for declaration and payment of import VAT on the one hand, and customs provisions regarding deferment of payment of customs duty and obligations of the person presenting the goods to customs on the other hand, and to guarantee the correct payment of import VAT where those arrangements are used, it should be specified that the monthly payment of import VAT under the special arrangements could be made subject to the normal conditions applied under customs law to authorise deferment of payment of import duty. Furthermore, it should be specified that the application of the special arrangements does not oblige Member States to require the person presenting the goods to customs to be empowered by the person for whom the goods are destined to present the goods to customs on his behalf.
